title: My favorite Hayazaki movie!
content: If I had only one 10 for Miyazaki's movies, I'd give it to this one! Although the story is one of the most complex ones, it really does have a proper plot from start to finish, unlike some other Miyazaki's movies which have weird endings/unfinished stories, well at least in my opinion... The visuals and the music are of course magnificent, I could listen to the soundtrack all day long... There are plenty of interesting, well-developed characters and of course Miyazaki's trademarks like an anti-war theme, flying aircrafts etc. There is a fine balance of action and ''calmer'' parts of the movie, also the line between magical and real is set very good in my opinion... I love how Howl's room is stuffed with so many things and looks so comfortable!^^ Whenever I'm feeling depressed, I like to watch this movie, especially the scenes that take place in large, open scenery like the woods and the mountains, it makes you feel very warm inside. One scene in particular always comes up first though, it's the one where they make and eat breakfast, I dunno why, maybe because the food looks so deliciousXD... Anyways, as a Miyazaki fan I urge you to watch this movie! You'll be taken into a world where not everything is perfect and good, but where friendship (and a little bit of magic;)) can do wonders!

title: pretty good movie
content: It's a pretty good movie. The art's good, the story's good, the characters are good, and it's based on a book. It is a bit to long though and the story kind of slows down at times.

title: Pure Magic.
content: Well done Mr. Miyazaki, you have proved once again that you can combine an excellent story line, creative imagination and visually stunning artwork to create magic. This movie upholds all standards of a Miyazaki film.When I first started watching this, I imagine my first impression was similar to those of many other: slight confusion, but incredibly mystified by the concept, unable to look away. It has the surreal and dreamy feel of Alice In Wonderland, and I couldn't help but be drawn into the story. The characters are well rounded, and the relationships between them are very interesting. The film has an incredible knack of surrounding you with all these events, thoughts and a dream-esqe atmosphere that you want to watch it again and again to relive this strange world.The soundtrack was lovely as well, and this movie is one I highly recommend to anyone open to being brought into a fantastic world you couldn't possibly imagine.

title: Stunningly beautiful!
content: I have no idea how there are so many people who underestimate this beautiful genre, especially, after seeing such an amazing piece of art!Hayao Miyazaki tells us an intense, adventurous, magical and innovative story packed (as usual) in beautiful and detailed pictures which make you want to watch this film countless times! Those gorgeous images really pull you into this world and you will stay in it until the credits run over your screen. It never gets boring! Another reason for that is the fact that Miyazaki comes up with various new ideas, such as the castle itself and its magic door and the development of the different characters.It simply is one of the best or even the best Hayao Miyazaki film out there and I am glad to own it on blu-ray as well! I have watched it plenty of times already and I am sure that I will be watching it soon again!

title: World of magic and wonder
content: "Howl's Moving Castle" is a mesmerizing journey into a world of magic and wonder. Miyazaki's animation is simply breathtaking, immersing you in a richly detailed universe filled with charm and whimsy. The characters, from the plucky Sophie to the enigmatic Howl, are wonderfully crafted and endearing, each adding their own layer of depth to the story. The film's narrative is a captivating blend of adventure, romance, and self-discovery, weaving together themes of courage, friendship, and the power of love. What truly sets "Howl's Moving Castle" apart is its ability to transport viewers to a place where anything is possible, where dreams come to life and imagination knows no bounds. It's a timeless masterpiece that enchants audiences of all ages, reminding us of the magic that resides within our hearts and the beauty of embracing our true selves.

Howl's Moving Castle, directed by the legendary Hayao Miyazaki and produced by Studio Ghibli, is a breathtaking animated fantasy that enchants viewers with its magical story, stunning animation, and richly developed characters. This film is a visual and emotional feast that appeals to both children and adults, offering a timeless tale of love, courage, and self-discovery.The story follows Sophie, a young woman cursed by a wicked witch and transformed into an elderly lady. She finds herself in the mysterious moving castle of the enigmatic wizard Howl. As Sophie becomes involved in Howl's world, she discovers not only the secrets of his magic but also the depth of her own inner strength. The film's narrative is beautifully layered, blending elements of fairy tales with profound themes of identity, war, and the acceptance of imperfection.The voice acting, whether in the original Japanese or the English dub, is superb. The English version features talented actors such as Emily Mortimer, Jean Simmons, Christian Bale, and Billy Crystal, who bring the characters to life with nuance and charm. The character designs are memorable, from Howl's mysterious allure to Calcifer's quirky, fire-demon personality.Visually, Howl's Moving Castle is a masterpiece. The animation is lush and detailed, showcasing Studio Ghibli's signature artistry. The castle itself, with its steampunk-inspired design, is a marvel of creativity, embodying the fantastical essence of the film. The landscapes are equally captivating, with vibrant, sprawling fields and picturesque towns that transport viewers to a world of wonder.The film's score, composed by Joe Hisaishi, is another highlight, providing a beautiful and evocative backdrop to the story. The music perfectly captures the film's whimsical and emotional tones, enhancing the overall experience.Howl's Moving Castle is commendable for its deep exploration of complex themes wrapped in a fantastical narrative. It offers a poignant commentary on the futility of war and the power of love and compassion to transcend boundaries. Miyazaki's vision shines through in every frame, making this film a testament to the power of animation as a medium for storytelling.
